Posts.Content: Jan 26, 2010 11:37PM Troglodyfae wrote: Hi Again Thank you all for your replies.  I did have extensive bruising in that the whole of my breast was black for a number of weeks.  The bruising is still there but is fading every day.  My breast is not warm to the touch or red and inflamed so I do not think there is an infection, plus my lymph glands are not up anywhere.  I am thinking because of the number of samples taken it has left some considerable damage, which I guess will go down in time.  I will go to see my family doc and see what he has to say on the matter, I will also give the cancer care nurses at the hospital a ring, where the biopsy took place,  and take advice from them, just to be on the safe side.  Thanks again
Posts.Title: Vacuum Biopsy Troglodyfae Mouse6

Posts.Content: Troglodyfae wrote: Hi  Sorry if this is in the wrong section but I was fairly uncertain where I should post this question.  I had a routine mammogram at the beginning of November of last year, and was called back very quickly for a needle biopsy because they had found an area of some concern on my right breast, albeit not a large area.  Ten days after having the needle biopsy I was called back again for a vacuum biopsy.  They were going to take 12 samples but ended up taking 18, so my breast was black with bruising.  Thankfully my test result showed that they had removed everything of concern. so that is brilliant news, I have a titanium marker in my breast now to show where they have been. I am however concerned that my breast is still quite bruised and I have noticable tissue loss and a very large hard, painful lump where the biopsy was performed.  Is this normal?  I would have thought that it would have healed by now, but I am a little reticent to go to my family doctor as I do not want to make a fuss over something that is normal.  Having not been through this proceedure before it is difficult to know what is and what is not normal. I wondered if any of you ladies who might have been through this could give me some answers. Thanks in advance Log in to post a reply
